title: How to write a meeting summary - Quora

response.answer_text: Date of the meetingTime of the meetingList of Attendees (if it is an internal meeting, no contact info, but if it is not, then contact info of each attendee, so that others can reach/communicate with them)Agenda (if there was a formal one, attach it to the meeting minutes)Topic AIssue.Discussion.Conclusion.Action item.Topic B (and on and on, depends on how many things were discussed)Issue.Discussion.Conclusion.Action item.Overall Action Items with delegated tasks.Next step - Follow-up meet, status meet, when, where and who.

Hello there! I have long been an opponent of using any online meeting tool (besides Skype). But then I came across this meeting tool that has everything I need to make my business meetings more productive. As an Account Manager I have many weekly meetings with various clients. I write the agenda, break down agenda tasks, invite meeting participants. Then during the meeting I take notes under each agenda topic. Looks like this:  This is an effective way to write a meeting summary and share it with your team and/or clients. Hope that helps!
